ygData.subject: RE: Stein Quest
ygData.msgSnippet: I think target can t be seen is caused by a counter being in the way. move around counter and you ll cast ok ... From: Jenni [mailto:freya@freya.cx] Sent:
ygData.messageBody:
I think "target can't be seen" is caused by a counter being in the way.
move around counter and you'll cast ok

-----Original Message-----
From: Jenni [mailto:freya@...]
Sent: Tuesday, November 30, 1999 1:21 PM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Stein Quest


From: Jenni <freya@...>

I'm a Dark Elf, with Innoruk as my deity. It's definately harder that way.
:)
I still can't go to Kaladim with any illusions, I need to stay invis all
through
Butcherblock. I'm ok so far everywhere else I've went, I think the only
towns I
haven't been to with this character are Ak'Anon and Grobb. I'm planning on
checking out AkAnon tonight. I figure since I'm on that side of the world
right
now I'll grab all the coins of Tash that I can. Someday I'll be able to use
them :)

I've never had Alliance "resisted", but when I cast on some NPC's it says I
cannot see my target even though I'm standing right next to them, and the
spell
doesn't take hold.. I think I read somewhere that Alliance is a non aggro
spell
as well, so it shouldn't cause them to attack. I'll have to check into that
one
again. :)

Ezrae

Rich Hitz wrote:

> From: Rich Hitz <Rich.Hitz@...>
>
> <snip>
> I never tried the alliance spell when the Ogre was in there, he killed me
> twice.
>
> <snip>
>
> What race do you play? Are you agnostic?
> I know that choosing an Evil god will make you KoS to the Ogre even if you
> have Illusion: Human up since somehow by using "The Force" they can sense
> the evil in you. Being Agnostic takes care of this problem though.
> Can Alliance be resisted? If so, then if cast on an NPC is it considered
an
> attack? This may explain why you "sometimes" may get attacked.
>
> --
> Bahir
